intro: Astragalus brevicarinatus, commonly known as the short-ribed milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Astragalus brevicarinatus is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
